full_summary:
# Floor Repair Services Tender Announcement

**Reference Number:** CB-638-44124608
**Solicitation Number:** 21301-24-4163144
**Publication Date:** October 25, 2023
**Tender Closing Date:** January 17, 2024, 2:00 PM ET

## Overview

The Correctional Service of Canada (CSC) is seeking a supplier to provide floor repair services for the Port-Cartier institution in Quebec, Canada. The services will be required from the date of award to December 31, 2025.

## Trade Agreements

This tender is subject to the following trade agreements:

* Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA)
* Canada-Panama Free Trade Agreement
* Canada-Colombia Free Trade Agreement
* Canada-Chile Free Trade Agreement (CCFTA)
* Canada-Honduras Free Trade Agreement
* Canada-Peru Free Trade Agreement (CPFTA)

## Procurement Method

All interested suppliers may submit a bid. The procurement method is competitive, open bidding.

## Selection Criteria

The selection criteria are:

* Lowest Price

## Regions of Opportunity

The services are required in:

* Quebec (except National Capital Region)

## Regions of Delivery

The services will be delivered in:

* Canada
* Quebec (except National Capital Region)

## Contracting Entity

The contracting authority is:

* Correctional Service Canada
* Contact: Karine Clément
* Email: [karine.clement@csc-scc.gc.ca](mailto:karine.clement@csc-scc.gc.ca)
* Phone: (514) 235-8177

## Notice URL

The notice URL is not available.

## Attachments

The following attachments are available:

* 4163144_addenda-1.pdf
* 4163144_addenda-2.pdf
* plan_0.pdf
* 4163144_rfso_0.pdf
* specifications-anglais.pdf

The attachments can be downloaded from the Canada Buys /Tenders Opportunities website.

## Important Notes

* The Crown reserves the right to negotiate with suppliers on any procurement.
* Documents may be submitted in either English or French.
* Suppliers may request a debriefing on the results of the bid solicitation process.

## Procurement Assistance

Procurement Assistance Canada (PAC) offers seminars to businesses interested in learning how to sell goods and services to the Government of Canada. The seminars are free and cover topics such as the federal government contracting process
